net.sf.jguiraffe.gui.builder.event.filter

Class AbstractChainedEventFilterTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.jguiraffe.gui.builder.event.filter.AbstractChainedEventFilterTest
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    TestAndEventFilter, TestOrEventFilter

    public abstract class AbstractChainedEventFilterTest
extends Object
    Base test class for classes derived from ChainedEventFilter. This class provides some test cases for accessing the child filters.
    Version:
    $Id: AbstractChainedEventFilterTest.java 205 2012-01-29 18:29:57Z oheger $
    Author:
    Oliver Heger

    • Field Summary

      Constant for an object that can be passed to the test filter.

    • Method Detail

      • createEmptyFilter

        protected abstract ChainedEventFilter createEmptyFilter()
        Creates a chained filter implementation that does not contain any child filters.
        Returns:
        an empty chained filter

      • createFilterWithChildren

        protected abstract ChainedEventFilter createFilterWithChildren(Collection<EventFilter> children)
        Creates a chained filter implementation that is initialized with the given list of child filters.
        Parameters:
        children - the list with child filters
        Returns:
        the chained filter

      • addMockFilter

        protected EventFilter addMockFilter(ChainedEventFilter cf,
                                    boolean accept,
                                    boolean init)
        Adds a filter mock as child to the given chained filter. This can be used to add filters with a defined behavior to the chained filter.
        Parameters:
        cf - the chained filter (can be null)
        accept - a flag for the return value of the mock filter's accept() method
        init - if true, the mock is initialized to expect an invocation of the accept() method and its replay() method is called
        Returns:
        the control object for the filter mock

      • createDummyFilter

        protected EventFilter createDummyFilter()
        Helper method for creating a dummy filter. This method returns an implementation of the EventFilter interface without any specific functionality.
        Returns:
        a filter dummy

      • createDummyFilterList

        protected Collection<EventFilter> createDummyFilterList(int size)
        Creates a collection with dummy filters of the given size.
        Parameters:
        size - the size
        Returns:
        a collection containing dummy filters

      • checkChildFilters

        protected void checkChildFilters(Collection<EventFilter> expected,
                                 ChainedEventFilter cf)
        Checks the filter's child filters.
        Parameters:
        expected - a list with the expected children
        cf - the filter to check

      • testInitEmpty

        public void testInitEmpty()
        Tests a newly created empty chained filter.

        public void testInitFromList()
        Tests creating a chained filter with a list of child filters.

      • testInitFromListModify

        public void testInitFromListModify()
        Tests that a defensive copy is made from the filter list passed to the constructor.

      • testInitFilterFromNullList

        public void testInitFilterFromNullList()
        Tests creating a chained filter with a null list. This should cause an exception.

      • testInitFilterFromListNullChildren

        public void testInitFilterFromListNullChildren()
        Tests creating a chained filter from a list that contains null elements. This should cause an exception.

      • testAddFilter

        public void testAddFilter()
        Tests adding a new filter.

        Tests adding a new null filter. This should cause an exception.

        public void testAddFiltersNull()
        Tests adding a null list of child filters. This should cause an exception.

        Tests the clear method.

      • testGetFiltersModify
